page.title: 07 BRECQHOU
page.content: Brecqhou is an island off the west coast of Sark.It is privately owned and therefore inaccessible to the General Public. The island which has a total area of 160 acres is surrounded by cliffs making any sea landing difficult.There is one sheltered landing on the south- west of the island and another to the north-east known as "Jacob's Ladder". Brecqhou has 70 acres of land available for farming and there is a working farm on the island.The owner's house and servants' cottages have been fully renovated.Generally,access is by helicopter and there is a landing pad on the island. Brecqhou is separated from Sark by a narrow stretch of water called the "Gouliot Passage" and the telephone link between the two islands can be seen straddling the gap.
